comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110615151330

Steps to reproduce:

Put Firefox on third or 4th monitor on my second ATI Video card. There is no problem as long as I keep Firefox functioning on the primary video card.


Actual results:

After several minutes aeroglass interface drops back to basic windows interface apparently because of too many resources being used.


Expected results:

Aeroglass should continue to function.
comments.author: jerrywlee@yahoo.com

comments.author: bob@bclary.com
comments.text: Please don't use the security flag gratuitously. It only limits the number of people who can see your bug and in no way increases a non security issue's priority.

xtc4uall@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
Please post the Content of the Graphics Section you can get via "about:support" with enabled Hardware Acceleration.

Is your Issue reproducible when you disable the Hardware Acceleration under Options/Advanced/General and restart Firefox?
comments.author: xtc4uall@gmail.com
